reviews.review_msg: Peter is fantastic. Super accessible and caring -- you can tell that he genuinely wants his students to succeed. The material can be a little dense, especially if you're not interested in rhetoric, but I personally found his courses to be interesting. I would definitely recommend!

If you can power through material that can drag, youll come out with a decent mark. He's a super helpful guy that wants everyone to succeed. 2 Papers and a midterm, which is the easiest multiple choice test I've taken. If you're looking for an easier 4th year english course, look for Peter. The material he teaches takes some time to figure out..

If your desire is to develop your writing skills then taking a class with Peter is a must. If you want inspiring lectures, then maybe stick to Everton and Budra; Peter's teaching style is different. He's a very smart guy and genuinely wants you to succeed, but you have to put in the work. His office hours are very useful and he's easy to talk to.

Peter is monotone, but is silly and the stuff he laughs is hilarious. He is a very easy marker since he believes in subjectivity and as long as you have a good argument or evidence, you will do great! He is also very good in office hours, and will help as much as he can. Overall, a great prof and seems like a pretty chill guy. I'd chill with him

grading scheme promotes success since your grade comes from participation, quiz based on lecture and readings, and two essays.  discourse analysis is totally different and a rewarding subject once you get the hang of it.  totally changed how I look at discourse.  Cramer's a funny guy and really helpful & available.  Totally recommend!
Peter is the best professor I've ever taken a class with. Very easy to approach with questions. I actually found him easy and pleasurable to listen to, but maybe that's just me... Highly recommend.

Cramer is awesome... in our class he enouraged a lot of class discussion, so sometimes there were long, awkward silences in class until someone piped up... but the topic of Verbal Hygiene is so interesting. I think he tried to stretch the topic over a whole semester when there could have been other topics covered, but it made it easy to study.
